com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.blockchainbusinessservices.blockchainvisibility

Class VisibilityUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.blockchainbusinessservices.blockchainvisibility.VisibilityUtils

  • @Beta
public class VisibilityUtils
extends Object
    This class is trying to help developers to work with MerkleTree class to:
    1. Create MerkleTree for given map of key/value pairs
    2. Get necessary data as MerkleProof to rebuild the same unique MerkleTree
    3. Validate given data against Merkle root
    Author:
    mehran.shakeri@sap.com

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VisibilityUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static MerkleTree buildMerkleTree(LinkedHashMap<String,String> keyValues)
      Default MessageDigest is set as SHA-256
      static MerkleTree buildMerkleTree(LinkedHashMap<String,String> keyValues, MessageDigest messageDigest)
      Returns a special MerkleTree serving visibility purpose and efficient in term of storage.
      First leaf in the result tree is list of all keys in a JSNO format: ["key1","key2"]
      Rest of the leaves are the values corresponding to the keys in the same order
      static MerkleProof getMerkleProof(MerkleTree tree, Set<Integer> leavesIndexesToShare)
      Generates and returns necessary information to proof given information are part of the same MerkleTree
      static MerkleProof mergeMerkleProofs(Set<MerkleProof> merkleProofs)
      Merges a set of MerkleProofs to one MerkleProof.
      static boolean validateMerkleProof(MerkleProof proof, String merkleRootHash)
      Validates a MerkleProof.

        public VisibilityUtils()

    • Method Detail

      • buildMerkleTree

        @Nonnull
public static MerkleTree buildMerkleTree(LinkedHashMap<String,String> keyValues)
                                           throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Default MessageDigest is set as SHA-256
        Parameters:
        keyValues - LinkedHashMap<String, String> keys can not contain "," character
        Returns:
        MerkleTree
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the used hashing algorithm is not available

      • buildMerkleTree

        @Nonnull
public static MerkleTree buildMerkleTree(@Nonnull
                                                  LinkedHashMap<String,String> keyValues,
                                                  @Nonnull
                                                  MessageDigest messageDigest)
        Returns a special MerkleTree serving visibility purpose and efficient in term of storage.
        First leaf in the result tree is list of all keys in a JSNO format: ["key1","key2"]
        Rest of the leaves are the values corresponding to the keys in the same order
        Parameters:
        keyValues - LinkedHashMap<String, String> keys can not contain "," character
        messageDigest - message digest to calculate hashing function
        Returns:
        MerkleTree

      • getMerkleProof

        @Nonnull
public static MerkleProof getMerkleProof(@Nonnull
                                                  MerkleTree tree,
                                                  @Nonnull
                                                  Set<Integer> leavesIndexesToShare)
        Generates and returns necessary information to proof given information are part of the same MerkleTree
        Parameters:
        tree - MerkleTree original Merkle tree
        leavesIndexesToShare - List<Integer> list of all leaves indexes we would like to share from the whole tree. Must only contain indexes that exist in the tree.
        Returns:
        MerkleProof minimum information required to proof shared leaves are part of the same given tree
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If leavesIndexesToShare is empty or contains any index that does not exist in the tree.

      • validateMerkleProof

        public static boolean validateMerkleProof(@Nonnull
                                          MerkleProof proof,
                                          @Nonnull
                                          String merkleRootHash)
                                   throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Validates a MerkleProof.
        Parameters:
        proof - MerkleProof to validate
        merkleRootHash - root hash, which should match the given proof
        Returns:
        true if the merkleProof matches to the merkleRootHash, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the proof's hashing algorithm is not supported on this system
        IllegalArgumentException - If the proof is invalid (does not have a hashing algorithm or has a root hash set)

      • mergeMerkleProofs

        @Nonnull
public static MerkleProof mergeMerkleProofs(@Nonnull
                                                     Set<MerkleProof> merkleProofs)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Merges a set of MerkleProofs to one MerkleProof. All MerkleProofs need to have the same number of leaves and needed to be built with the same hashing algorithm and protocol version.
        Parameters:
        merkleProofs - set of MerkleProofs
        Returns:
        MerkleProof
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the Set of Proof are not mergeable.
